About.title: Interactive Mental Health
About.p1: Mentally is a Mental Health Support System which is a 24/7 AI-powered platform designed to provide personalized mental health support.
About.p2: It uses advanced technologies such as sentiment analysis and smart chatbots to analyze emotions and offer tailored recommendations.
About.p3: The platform also provides users with tools like meditation exercises, group therapy and mental health progress tracking for holistic emotional well-being.

AI-powered analysis.title: AI-powered analysis
AI-powered analysis.description: Advanced algorithms analyze your emotional state and provide personalized support.

group therapy.title: group therapy
group therapy.description: Connect with others in moderated group sessions for experience and support.

personalized insights.description: Begin your journey to better mental health with personalized insights and tracking.

Chatbot.title: start your journey to better mental health
Chatbot.description: Take the first step towards a healthier mind with our interactive platform.

faqs.question: How does the AI analysis work?
faqs.answer: Our AI system uses advanced natural language processing to analyze your responses and emotional patterns, providing personalized support and recommendations based on your unique situation.

faqs.question: Are the group therapy sessions confidential?
faqs.answer: Yes, all group therapy sessions are completely confidential and moderated by licensed professionals. We maintain strict privacy standards to ensure a safe space for all participants.

faqs.question: How often should I use the platform?
faqs.answer: We recommend regular check-ins, ideally daily or weekly, to get the most benefit from the platform. However, you can use it as frequently as you need based on your personal circumstances.

faqs.question: Can I track my progress over time?
faqs.answer: Yes, our platform provides detailed progress tracking through personalized insights, charts, and regular assessment reports to help you monitor your mental health journey.

testimonials.quote: This platform has transformed how I manage my mental health. The AI analysis is incredibly accurate.

testimonials.quote: The group therapy sessions have given me a supportive community I never knew I needed.

testimonials.quote: The personalized insights helped me understand my patterns and make positive changes.

Articles.title: mental health conditions
Articles.description: Learn more about different mental health conditions, their symptoms, causes, and treatments.

conditions.title: Depression
conditions.description: A mental disorder characterized by persistent sadness and loss of interest in daily activities.
conditions.definition: A mental disorder characterized by persistent sadness, loss of interest in daily activities, and low energy.
symptoms: Loss of interest in daily activities
Changes in appetite and sleep patterns
causes: Chemical imbalances in the brain (e.g., serotonin deficiency)

conditions.title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)
conditions.description: A disorder characterized by excessive and persistent worry about everyday situations.
conditions.definition: A mental disorder characterized by excessive and persistent worry about everyday situations without a clear reason.
treatment: Relaxation techniques such as meditation and yoga

conditions.title: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
conditions.description: A disorder involving unwanted repetitive thoughts and behaviors.
conditions.definition: A disorder characterized by unwanted repetitive thoughts (obsessions) and repetitive behaviors (compulsions).
symptoms: The need for extreme order and organization
treatment: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (Exposure and Response Prevention - ERP)

conditions.title: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
conditions.description: A disorder that develops after exposure to traumatic events.
conditions.definition: A disorder that develops after exposure to a traumatic event such as war, assault, or accidents.
symptoms: Avoidance of trauma-related places or people
Hypervigilance and strong reactions to triggers

conditions.title: Schizophrenia
conditions.description: A severe mental disorder affecting thinking, perception, and behavior.
conditions.definition: A severe mental disorder that affects thinking, perception, and behavior.

conditions.title: Bipolar Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder characterized by extreme mood swings including mania and depression.
conditions.definition: A mental disorder characterized by extreme mood swings, including episodes of mania and depression.
symptoms: Manic episodes (high energy, reduced sleep, excessive confidence)

conditions.title: Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD)
conditions.description: A disorder involving emotional instability and unstable relationships.
conditions.definition: A personality disorder characterized by emotional instability, unstable relationships, and impulsive behavior.

conditions.title: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
conditions.description: A neurodevelopmental disorder affecting focus and impulse control.
conditions.definition: A neurodevelopmental disorder affecting focus, impulse control, and hyperactivity.

conditions.title: Eating Disorders
conditions.description: Disorders related to unhealthy eating behaviors and body image.
conditions.definition: Disorders related to unhealthy eating behaviors, such as anorexia nervosa and bulimia nervosa.
symptoms: Loss of control over eating habits
causes: Societal pressure and body image expectations

conditions.title: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)
conditions.description: A developmental disorder affecting communication and social interactions.
conditions.definition: A developmental disorder affecting communication and social interactions.
symptoms: Difficulty with eye contact and social communication

conditions.title: Panic Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder involving sudden and repeated panic attacks.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving sudden and repeated panic attacks.
symptoms: Chest pain and shortness of breath

conditions.title: Social Anxiety Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder characterized by intense fear of social situations.
conditions.definition: A disorder characterized by intense fear of social situations.
symptoms: Physical symptoms like sweating or blushing

conditions.title: Specific Phobias
conditions.description: A disorder involving intense fear of specific objects or situations.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving intense fear of specific objects or situations.

conditions.title: Dissociative Identity Disorder (DID)
conditions.description: A disorder involving a disconnection from reality and multiple identities.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving a disconnection from reality and multiple identities.

conditions.title: Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD)
conditions.description: A type of depression related to seasonal changes.
conditions.definition: A type of depression related to seasonal changes.

conditions.title: Substance Use Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder involving the harmful use of substances like drugs or alcohol.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving the harmful use of substances like drugs or alcohol.
symptoms: Loss of control over substance use

conditions.title: Insomnia Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
conditions.definition: A disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.

conditions.title: Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD)
conditions.description: A severe form of PMS affecting mood and physical health.
conditions.definition: A severe form of PMS affecting mood and physical health.

conditions.title: Hoarding Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder involving excessive accumulation of items.
conditions.definition: A disorder involving excessive accumulation of items.
symptoms: Distress at the thought of throwing things away

conditions.title: Adjustment Disorder
conditions.description: A disorder caused by difficulty coping with a stressful life event.
conditions.definition: A disorder caused by difficulty coping with a stressful life event.
causes: Major life changes (e.g., divorce, job loss)
